title: De Ponte Cellars 2015 D.F.B. Melon de Bourgogne (Dundee Hills)
description: This lush and lovely wine, a New World version of Muscadet, is tangy and loaded with bright apple and pear flavors. Amplified by hints of citrus rind, it opens up even further once it warms in the glass, showing unexpected and quite impressive depth and detail.

title: Château Clément-Pichon 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: Under the same management as Château la Dominique in Saint-Émilion, this wine, dominated by ripe Merlot, is full, open and developing quickly. There's a rich edge to the black fruits as well as some powerful tannins that will need to soften. It is an open, generous wine, full of fruit and richly structured. Drink from 2023.

title: Château de Panigon 2015  Médoc
description: Dating to before the French Revolution, this estate produces some rich, generous wines. This vintage is in that mold, with its rounded black fruits, crisp acidity and solid core of dry tannins. The structure will allow the wine to age, giving great potential. Drink from 2024.

title: Château du Breuil 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: Under the same ownership as Château Cissac, this ancient estate, dating to the 6th century, is producing some fine wines. This rich vintage is well structured, dense and with classic black-currant Cabernet Sauvignon flavors. Ripe Merlot adds its rich jamminess to a wine that is still young. Drink from 2024.

title: Château du Retout 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: With over 80% Cabernet Sauvignon in the this Kopp family blend, this wine is packed with black currants, ripe tannins and a smoky backdrop from the wood aging. It is structured, dry and juicy at the same time. With this firm core, the wine will need aging, so drink from 2024.

title: Château La Branne 2015  Médoc
description: Aged for a year in wood, this wine has a toasty character. At the same time, it also has good fruit, plenty of black-currant flavors and acidity. A well-wrought wine, it melds the tannins and fruit into a balanced whole. Drink from 2024.

title: Château la Valière 2015  Médoc
description: Owned by the Pagès family, this rich wine is dense and structured. It has layers of dusty tannins and full black-currant fruit from the 60% Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend. Drink this firm wine with great fruit from 2023.

title: Bestheim 2014 Exception Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: Hints of vanilla and woodsmoke combine with subtle red cherry on the nose. The body is gentle, translucent and light, handled with a welcome, light touch. This is an earthy, elegant Pinot which shows a lovely warmth but vivid freshness in cherry fruit at its core.

title: Betz Family 2015 La Côte Rousse Syrah (Red Mountain)
description: Intriguing aromas of boysenberry syrup, plum, sweet herb and barrel spice lead to exquisitely balanced, somewhat elegantly styled fruit and savory flavors. It's a very understated, very pretty expression of this warm vintage and growing region.

title: Bodega Classica 2009 Hacienda Lopez de Haro Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy plum and cherry aromas are typical of Rioja gran reserva. A full, grabby palate is not silky-smooth, while this wine tastes of fig and chocolaty berry fruits that are on the cusp of cooked. It loses steam on a finish with raisiny notes. Drink through 2022.
designation: Hacienda Lopez de Haro Gran Reserva

title: Campo alle Comete 2015 Rosso Stupore  (Bolgheri)
description: Heady aromas suggesting grilled herb, sea breeze, wild berry and eucalyptus lead the nose. Made with Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Petit Verdot, the tightly knit palate offers dried black cherry, red currant, white pepper and star anise framed in taut, fine-grained tannins.

title: Château Bellevue 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This 100% Merlot wine is soft, voluptuous and packed with bold fruits. It is rich, dense and full of great fruit, cut by ample acidity and solidified with tannins. It is likely to age quickly, and will be ready to drink by 2020.

title: Château Petit Faurie de Soutard 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. While the oak influences on this wine are brazen at this stage, it is the fruit that promises an excellent future—black currants and spice are both in abundance on the palate. The firm tannic background will require this wine age. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Rieussec 2017 Carmes de Rieussec Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. Ripe and honeyed, this is already delicious. It's light as a vintage but has fine marmalade and apricot flavors which make it accessible for short-term enjoyment.

title: Château Cos d'Estournel 2017 Cos d'Estournel Blanc Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This wine is soft and ripe. Tropical fruit flavors are balanced by zesty citrus, resulting in a crisp and perfumed character. Drink from 2019.

title: Château Rieussec 2017 R de Rieussec Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This delicious, fruity wine is crisp while also rounded. Like many dry whites from Sauternes, it has a hint of honey as well as delicious citrus flavors. It will be ready to drink soon.

title: Château du Breuil 2017 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. Firm tannins permeate this toasty wine. It is well structured and concentrated with dark black-fruit flavors. As a contrast, the intense acidity keeps the wine fresh and fruity.

title: Château Larose Perganson 2017 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This is a wine that will have a good future, thanks to its bright, fresh black-currant fruit and some firm tannins. Its structure is not heavy, but it does have the weight to age well. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Pibran 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. With a higher-than-usual percentage of Merlot, this wine offers layers of ripe black fruit flavors. It has a rounded feel, with generous fruits and intense acidity. Overall, it is soft and full on the palate.

title: Château Cantelys 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This wine shows an herbal element blended with ripe tropical flavors on the nose. The crispness of the palate contrasts with richer apple and apricot flavors. The finish is open and perfumed. Drink from 2019.

title: Château Bernadotte 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: Formerly the property of one of Napoleon's generals, this estate is now performing impressively after renovations. This wine is richly structured and packed with black fruits. Dark tannins vie with black currants and ripe spice in this wine that will age well. Drink from 2024.

title: Château Couhins 2015  Pessac-Léognan
description: This is a fruity wine with lovely acidity and a firm background of tannins. The black-currant and berry flavors are up front, giving delicious acidity and a crisp aftertaste. Drink this fruity wine from 2023.

title: Château de Côme 2015  Saint-Estèphe
description: A seriously structured and dense wine, this is also rich in dark plum and damson fruits. It also offers spice and dry tannins. Concentrated and dark, the wine is going to be slow to develop, its tannins needing plenty of time. Drink from 2025.

title: Château Yon Figeac 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This is one of the large number of small estates in west Saint-Emilion's important Figeac neighborhood. The wine is dense yet juicy, with black fruit flavors and layers of attractive acidity. Drink from 2024.

title: Château Anthonic 2017 Barrel Sample  (Moulis-en-Médoc)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. Dominated by intense, perfumed Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine is crisp, full of black currant fruitiness and layers of tannins. It's juicy and fruity, with the ability to age over the medium term. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Cambon la Pelouse 2017 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This spicy wine is structured and firm, with concentrated yet juicy cassis flavors. The tannins at the end promise plenty of aging. Drink from 2022.

title: Château Lestage Simon 2017 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. Tannins and great black-currant fruits are already giving this generous wine its warm, ripe future. The smoky wood notes and dry core are the promise of an ageworthy wine. Drink from 2024.

title: Château Ferrière 2017 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. There are plenty of firm tannins here as well as fine blackberry fruit. It is a crisp wine, with the intense acidity of the vintage. Spice and a dry core show the need for aging. Drink from 2024.

title: Château Tour des Termes 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Estèphe)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This wine has plenty of ripe fruit backed by serious tannins. It is a solid, full-bodied wine, juicy and well concentrated. Drink from 2024.

title: Château Sociando-Mallet 2017 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This wine offers a blackberry fruit flavor framed by crisp acidity and fine-grained tannins. It has a dry core, with plenty of spice and fruit tones to broaden it out.
